reviews.text: I was quite surprised at how large this garden is. I was expecting just a few plants, but there are very many here organised in groupings based on what body system the plant is supposed to help, eg, respiratory & circulatory systems, Reproductive system etc. Information boards tell you about each plant and its health benefits. This is a very interesting garden, the only reason I don't give it 5 stars is because it doesn't have the beautiful visual impact which you get from the colourful Orchid garden.

Nice place to take a walk after a hearty meal at Sprouts.
Saw a rooster in the tree crowing incessantly once every 30 seconds.

The Healing Garden is organized according to how its plants are helpful to different body parts. As a garden in the Singapore Botanic Gardens, it is quite big. You can enter in via Gelam Gate or Neem Gate.

The Fragrant Garden is next to it, so you can hit two places at one go.

Healing Garden showcase plants that has medicinal values. The entire Garden spanning a large area is organised into sections by its healing properties benefiting various human organs like Ear, Nose, Throat, Neck and Head; Respiratory and Circulatory system; Digestion and Stomach; Skin, Nervous System, Muscles and Skeleton; etc.
note: The displayed informations are purely for general knowledge purposes. It's NOT intended for clinical uses.
This is such a great place to learning herbal benefits. Even very common plants like papaya and sugarcane we take for granted too have great benefits.
So much wildlife to see here. fortunate that when I went, the rare black naped monarch showed up
